author: m.kalinin
content: How so? Validator is not eligible for partial withdrawal unless its `effective_balance == MAX_EFFECTIVE_BALANCE`. So, it won't be skimmed if `effective_balance` is lower than that threshold regardless of the `balance` amount.

author: jgm
content: Ah yes, you are correct. Was thinking it triggered off balance rather than effective balance.

author: killari.
content: I was looking at ethereum' reorgs. And it seems like there were **eight** 1 block reorgs within 24h, any ideas why these are so common? <https://etherscan.io/blocks_forked>

author: killari.
content: I was wondering if this is caused by the fact that the validators should create their block as late as possible to accumulate the highest paying transactions?

author: sproul
content:
Lighthouse (since the most recent 2 versions) will re-org any block arriving later than 4s to incentivise validators to publish on time (and _not_ hoard MEV/transactions).

More here: 

- <https://lighthouse-book.sigmaprime.io/late-block-re-orgs.html>
- <https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3034>
